sagex.phoenix

Class Phoenix

  • java.lang.Object
    • sagex.phoenix.Phoenix

  • public class Phoenix
extends java.lang.Object
    Phoenix is the main entry point into getting various core sub managers, such as Menu Manager, Configuration Metadata, etc.

    The Phoenix Home Dir can be set to an alternat location (for testing) using the System property, "phoenix/homeDir".

      • addOnLoad

        public static void addOnLoad(java.lang.Runnable r)
        Adds a task to phoenix to run once Phoenix has been loaded. If phoenix is loaded, then the task is executed immediately.
        Parameters:
        r -

      • fireOnLoadEvents

        protected void fireOnLoadEvents()
        Fires the onload events, and then clears the list.

      • getUserCacheEntry

        public java.io.File getUserCacheEntry(java.lang.String folder,
                                      java.lang.String filepath)
        Gets a cache file from the the user's cache area for the given folder and filepath and name.
        Parameters:
        folder - cache sub folder, ie, 'videos', 'tv', 'web', 'images', etc
        filepath - file url/filepath being cached, ie, 'http://some.onlinevideo.com/videos/videofile.mp4'
        Returns:
        File of the cached entity or null if a cached entity could be created.

      • invokeLater

        public void invokeLater(java.lang.Runnable r)
        The following running will run in a background thread, when there is time. Typically these tasks should not run for a long time, ie, a few seconds at most, since the entire background thread pool will serialize these requests such that there is only a couples of tasks running at a time.
        Parameters:
        r -
